name: D. Counting Pairs
input: InputThe first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases.Each test case consists of two lines:  The first line contains three integers $$$n, x, y$$$ ($$$3 \le n \le 2 \cdot 10^5$$$, $$$1 \le x \le y \le 2 \cdot 10^{14}$$$);  The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \dots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \le a_i \le 10^{9}$$$). Additional constraint on the input: the sum of $$$n$$$ across all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \cdot 10^5$$$.
output: OutputFor each test case, output one integer — the number of interesting pairs of integers for the given sequence $$$a$$$.
